page.title: 04The Bronze Pigs of Calne.
page.content: The Bronze pigs were sculpted by Mr. Richard Cowdy.The Calne Civic Society asked him to make a sculpture to commemorate the Harris Bacon Company of Calne,<now defunct>. Richard Cowdy sculpted them in bronze in 1979.They are the only ones like it in the world.They are in Phelps Parade,a modern shopping street in the centre of Calne's commercial district. Mr.Cowdy works in an old school building,the former Guthrie School of Calne.A new Guthrie School has been built elsewhere. A Calne sculptress is Vivienne ap Rhys Pryce. Mr. Sean Crampton is another Calne sculptor,he lives in Quemerford.
